verses.verse: And straightway <S%G2112><s%> in the morning <S%G4404><s%> the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> held <S%G4160><s%> a consultation <S%G4824><s%> with the elders <S%G4245><s%> and scribes <S%G1122><s%> and the whole <S%G3650><s%> council, <S%G4892><s%> and bound <S%G1210><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> and carried <S%G667><s%> him away, <S%G667><s%> and delivered <S%G3860><s%> him to Pilate. <S%G4091><s%>

And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> asked <S%G1905><s%> him, Are <S%G1488><s%> you the King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews? <S%G2453><s%> And he answering <S%G611><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to them, You say <S%G3004><s%> it.
And the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> accused <S%G2723><s%> him of many <S%G4183><s%> things: but he answered <S%G611><s%> nothing. <S%G3756><s%> <S%G3762><s%>

And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> asked <S%G1905><s%> him again, <S%G3825><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> Answer <S%G611><s%> you nothing? <S%G3756><s%> behold <S%G2396><s%> how <S%G4214><s%> many <S%G4214><s%> things they witness <S%G2649><s%> against you.
But Jesus <S%G2424><s%> yet <S%G3765><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> nothing; <S%G3756><s%> <S%G3762><s%> so <S%G5620><s%> that Pilate <S%G4091><s%> marveled. <S%G2296><s%>
Now <S%G1161><s%> at <S%G2596><s%> that feast <S%G1859><s%> he released <S%G630><s%> to them one <S%G1520><s%> prisoner, <S%G1198><s%> whomsoever <S%G3746><s%> they desired. <S%G154><s%>

And there was one named <S%G3004><s%> Barabbas, <S%G912><s%> which lay bound <S%G1210><s%> with them that had made <S%G4955><s%> insurrection <S%G4955><s%> with him, who <S%G3748><s%> had committed <S%G4160><s%> murder <S%G5408><s%> in the insurrection. <S%G4714><s%>
And the multitude <S%G3793><s%> crying <S%G310><s%> aloud <S%G310><s%> began <S%G756><s%> to desire <S%G154><s%> him to do as he had ever <S%G104><s%> done <S%G4160><s%> to them.
But Pilate <S%G4091><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> them, saying, <S%G3004><s%> Will <S%G2309><s%> you that I release <S%G630><s%> to you the King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews? <S%G2453><s%>
For he knew <S%G1097><s%> that the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> had delivered <S%G3860><s%> him for envy. <S%G5355><s%>
But the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> moved <S%G383><s%> the people, <S%G3793><s%> that he should rather <S%G3123><s%> release <S%G630><s%> Barabbas <S%G912><s%> to them.

And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> and said <S%G2036><s%> again <S%G3825><s%> to them, What <S%G5101><s%> will <S%G2309><s%> you then <S%G3767><s%> that I shall do <S%G4160><s%> to him whom <S%G3739><s%> you call <S%G3004><s%> the King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews? <S%G2453><s%>
And they cried <S%G2896><s%> out again, <S%G3825><s%> Crucify <S%G4717><s%> him.

Then <S%G1161><s%> Pilate <S%G4091><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to them, Why, <S%G1063><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> evil <S%G2556><s%> has he done? <S%G4160><s%> And they cried <S%G2896><s%> out the more <S%G4056><s%> exceedingly, <S%G4056><s%> Crucify <S%G4717><s%> him.

And so Pilate, <S%G4091><s%> willing <S%G1014><s%> to content <S%G2425><s%> the people, <S%G3793><s%> released <S%G630><s%> Barabbas <S%G912><s%> to them, and delivered <S%G3860><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> when he had scourged <S%G5417><s%> him, to be crucified. <S%G4717><s%>

And the soldiers <S%G4757><s%> led <S%G520><s%> him away <S%G520><s%> into <S%G2080><s%> the hall, <S%G833><s%> called <S%G3739><s%> <S%G2076><s%> Praetorium; <S%G4232><s%> and they call <S%G4779><s%> together <S%G4779><s%> the whole <S%G3650><s%> band. <S%G4686><s%>
And they clothed <S%G1746><s%> him with purple, <S%G4209><s%> and platted <S%G4120><s%> a crown <S%G4735><s%> of thorns, <S%G174><s%> and put <S%G4060><s%> it about <S%G4060><s%> his head,
And began <S%G756><s%> to salute <S%G782><s%> him, Hail, <S%G5463><s%> King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews! <S%G2453><s%>

And they smote <S%G5180><s%> him on the head <S%G2776><s%> with a reed, <S%G2563><s%> and did spit <S%G1716><s%> on him, and bowing <S%G5087><s%> their knees <S%G1119><s%> worshipped <S%G4352><s%> him.

And when <S%G3753><s%> they had mocked <S%G1702><s%> him, they took <S%G1562><s%> off <S%G609><s%> the purple <S%G4209><s%> from him, and put <S%G1746><s%> his own <S%G2398><s%> clothes <S%G2440><s%> on <S%G1746><s%> him, and led <S%G1806><s%> him out to crucify <S%G4717><s%> him.

And they compel <S%G29><s%> one <S%G5100><s%> Simon <S%G4613><s%> a Cyrenian, <S%G2956><s%> who passed <S%G3855><s%> by, coming <S%G2064><s%> out of the country, <S%G68><s%> the father <S%G3962><s%> of Alexander <S%G223><s%> and Rufus, <S%G4504><s%> to bear <S%G142><s%> his cross. <S%G4716><s%>
And they bring <S%G5342><s%> him to the place <S%G5117><s%> Golgotha, <S%G1115><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> is, being interpreted, <S%G3177><s%> The place <S%G5117><s%> of a skull. <S%G2898><s%>
And they gave <S%G1325><s%> him to drink <S%G4095><s%> wine <S%G3631><s%> mingled with myrrh: <S%G4669><s%> but he received <S%G2983><s%> it not.

And when they had crucified <S%G4717><s%> him, they parted <S%G1266><s%> his garments, <S%G2440><s%> casting <S%G906><s%> lots <S%G2819><s%> on them, what <S%G5101><s%> every <S%G5100><s%> man should take. <S%G142><s%>
And it was the third <S%G5154><s%> hour, <S%G5610><s%> and they crucified <S%G4717><s%> him.
And the superscription <S%G1923><s%> of his accusation <S%G156><s%> was written <S%G1924><s%> over, <S%G1924><s%> THE KING <S%G935><s%> OF THE JEWS. <S%G2453><s%>

And with him they crucify <S%G4717><s%> two <S%G1417><s%> thieves; <S%G3027><s%> the one <S%G1520><s%> on <S%G1537><s%> his right <S%G1188><s%> hand, and the other <S%G1520><s%> on <S%G1537><s%> his left. <S%G2176><s%>
And the scripture <S%G1124><s%> was fulfilled, <S%G4137><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> And he was numbered <S%G3049><s%> with the transgressors. <S%G459><s%>

And they that passed <S%G3899><s%> by railed <S%G987><s%> on him, wagging <S%G2795><s%> their heads, <S%G2776><s%> and saying, <S%G3004><s%> Ah, <S%G3758><s%> you that destroy <S%G2647><s%> the temple, <S%G3485><s%> and build <S%G3618><s%> it in three <S%G5140><s%> days, <S%G2250><s%>
Save <S%G4982><s%> yourself, <S%G4572><s%> and come <S%G2597><s%> down <S%G2597><s%> from the cross. <S%G4716><s%>

Likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> mocking <S%G1702><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> among <S%G4314><s%> themselves <S%G240><s%> with the scribes, <S%G1122><s%> He saved <S%G4982><s%> others; <S%G243><s%> himself <S%G1438><s%> he cannot <S%G3756><s%> <S%G1410><s%> save. <S%G4982><s%>

Let Christ <S%G5547><s%> the King <S%G935><s%> of Israel <S%G2474><s%> descend <S%G2597><s%> now <S%G3568><s%> from the cross, <S%G4716><s%> that we may see <S%G1492><s%> and believe. <S%G4100><s%> And they that were crucified <S%G4957><s%> with him reviled <S%G3679><s%> him.

And when the sixth <S%G1623><s%> hour <S%G5610><s%> was come, <S%G1096><s%> there was darkness <S%G4655><s%> over <S%G1909><s%> the whole <S%G3650><s%> land <S%G1095><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> the ninth <S%G1766><s%> hour. <S%G5610><s%>

And at the ninth <S%G1766><s%> hour <S%G5610><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> cried <S%G994><s%> with a loud <S%G3173><s%> voice, <S%G5456><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> Eloi, <S%G1682><s%> Eloi, <S%G1682><s%> lama <S%G2982><s%> sabachthani? <S%G4518><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> is, being interpreted, <S%G3177><s%> My God, <S%G2316><s%> my God, <S%G2316><s%> why <S%G1519><s%> <S%G5101><s%> have you forsaken <S%G1459><s%> me?
And some <S%G5100><s%> of them that stood <S%G3936><s%> by, when they heard <S%G191><s%> it, said, <S%G3004><s%> Behold, <S%G2400><s%> he calls <S%G5455><s%> Elias. <S%G2243><s%>

And one <S%G1520><s%> ran <S%G5143><s%> and filled <S%G1072><s%> a sponge <S%G4699><s%> full of vinegar, <S%G3690><s%> and put <S%G4060><s%> it on <S%G4060><s%> a reed, <S%G2563><s%> and gave <S%G4222><s%> him to drink, <S%G4222><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> Let <S%G863><s%> alone; <S%G863><s%> let us see <S%G1492><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> Elias <S%G2243><s%> will come <S%G2064><s%> to take <S%G2507><s%> him down. <S%G2507><s%>
And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> cried <S%G863><s%> with a loud <S%G3173><s%> voice, <S%G5456><s%> and gave up the ghost. <S%G1606><s%>
And the veil <S%G2665><s%> of the temple <S%G3485><s%> was rent <S%G4977><s%> in two <S%G1417><s%> from the top <S%G509><s%> to the bottom. <S%G2736><s%>

And when the centurion, <S%G2760><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> stood <S%G3936><s%> over <S%G1537><s%> <S%G1727><s%> against <S%G1537><s%> <S%G1727><s%> him, saw <S%G1492><s%> that he so <S%G3779><s%> cried <S%G2896><s%> out, and gave up the ghost, <S%G1606><s%> he said, <S%G2036><s%> Truly <S%G230><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G444><s%> was the Son <S%G5207><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>

There were also <S%G2532><s%> women <S%G1135><s%> looking <S%G2334><s%> on afar <S%G3113><s%> off: <S%G575><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> was Mary <S%G3137><s%> Magdalene, <S%G3094><s%> and Mary <S%G3137><s%> the mother <S%G3384><s%> of James <S%G2385><s%> the less <S%G3398><s%> and of Joses, <S%G2500><s%> and Salome; <S%G4539><s%>

(Who <S%G3739><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> when <S%G3753><s%> he was in Galilee, <S%G1056><s%> followed <S%G190><s%> him, and ministered <S%G1247><s%> to him;) and many <S%G4183><s%> other <S%G243><s%> women which <S%G3588><s%> came <S%G4872><s%> up with him to Jerusalem. <S%G2414><s%>
And now <S%G2235><s%> when the even <S%G3798><s%> was come, <S%G1096><s%> because <S%G1893><s%> it was the preparation, <S%G3904><s%> that is, the day before <S%G4315><s%> the sabbath, <S%G4315><s%>

Joseph <S%G2501><s%> of Arimathaea, <S%G707><s%> an honorable <S%G2158><s%> counselor, <S%G1010><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> <S%G846><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> waited <S%G4327><s%> for the kingdom <S%G932><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> came, <S%G2064><s%> and went <S%G1525><s%> in boldly <S%G5111><s%> to Pilate, <S%G4091><s%> and craved <S%G154><s%> the body <S%G4983><s%> of Jesus. <S%G2424><s%>

And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> marveled <S%G2296><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> he were already <S%G2235><s%> dead: <S%G2348><s%> and calling <S%G4341><s%> to him the centurion, <S%G2760><s%> he asked <S%G1905><s%> him whether <S%G1487><s%> he had been any while <S%G3819><s%> dead. <S%G599><s%>
And when he knew <S%G1097><s%> it of the centurion, <S%G2760><s%> he gave <S%G1433><s%> the body <S%G4983><s%> to Joseph. <S%G2501><s%>

And he bought <S%G59><s%> fine linen, <S%G4616><s%> and took <S%G2507><s%> him down, <S%G2507><s%> and wrapped <S%G1750><s%> him in the linen, <S%G4616><s%> and laid <S%G2698><s%> him in a sepulcher <S%G3419><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> was hewn <S%G2998><s%> out of a rock, <S%G4073><s%> and rolled <S%G4351><s%> a stone <S%G3037><s%> to the door <S%G2374><s%> of the sepulcher. <S%G3419><s%>
And Mary <S%G3137><s%> Magdalene <S%G3094><s%> and Mary <S%G3137><s%> the mother of Joses <S%G2500><s%> beheld <S%G2334><s%> where <S%G4226><s%> he was laid. <S%G5087><s%>
